title: Wexford plane crash: Two people die after aircraft 'explodes' in Ireland
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Two men have died in a plane crash in rural Ireland this evening.

Gardaí and emergency services are currently at the scene of the accident which occurred at approximately 5.45pm this evening.

The Air Accident Investigation unit is travelling to the scene and the Irish Aviation Authority have been notified.

The bodies of the men are still at the scene.

Initial reports indicate that the small airplane exploded, either on impact with the ground or shortly beforehand, in a field in this rural part of Wexford, close to the coastline and Kilmore Quay, reports RTE.

The light aircraft is believed to have taken off from an air field in the Taghmon area of Wexford, just minutes from the crash location, according to the Irish broadcaster.

We'll be bringing you the very latest updates, pictures and video on this breaking news story.

Please check back regularly for updates on this developing story here at Mirror.co.uk.

description: A light aircraft came down near Duncormick in Co Wexford this evening and the Irish Aviation Authority have been notified
